events.eventSummary: A hacker claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on ENSAI (Ã‰cole nationale de la statistique et de l'information), leaking 21 GB of data including profiles of 3,900 students.
An attacker drained approximately $3.9 million from Unleash Protocol in a cryptocurrency exploit.
The 3GH INC Ransom hacking group claims to have breached 3GH, a Spanish ICT sector company, and has provided data samples as proof.
Admin credentials were reportedly exposed in source code provided by a hosting provider.

dailyBrief: Cyber threats surged today with two high-severity incidents: a major student data leak at ENSAI and a multimillion-dollar crypto exploit targeting Unleash Protocol. Additional breaches include ransomware claims against Spanish firm 3GH INC and exposed admin credentials at a hosting provider. The prevalence of data leaks and financial hacks underscores heightened risks for both organizations and individuals. Vigilance and rapid incident response are strongly advised.
